document.title: Model School Library Standards for California Public Schools, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve

07FF02415221427F8B125FA55683BA98.description: Evaluate one's own research process and that of others in a respectful, cooperative, and productive way.

729D6F379ECB4E129142155BEF15BC3D.description: Appreciate a range of creative forms of expression (e.g., poetry, drama, film, literature, visual arts).

6F23EED41C894110975BC9C6F545CA02.description: Demonstrate a variety of methods to engage the audience when presenting information (e.g., voice modulation, gestures, questions).

9949F6E3440644BB9EC2C027D7728080.description: Appreciate and respond to creative expressions of information:

0358FB0A2B7F410ABB31BC0B5F7CE29C.description: Collaborate in person and through technology to identify problems and seek solutions.

89AD9EF530D242398E334E8DEE31A655.description: Pursue information related to personal well-being (e.g., career interests, community involvement, health matters, recreation).

6CEADF837CEC41AE8728F5C0EDF7403D.description: Respect others' right to freedom of speech.

C008EEE049CB4B06B8CF46774B90C46E.description: Participate in activities that reflect interests, talents, or desires.

EBA842AD4CD2464CAEA92608907216DC.description: Read a good representation of grade-level-appropriate text, making progress toward the goal of reading one million words annually by grade eight (e.g., classic and contemporary literature, magazines, newspapers, online information).

A4351F7F43374B12BE8855C187680850.description: Read widely and use various media for information, personal interest, and lifelong learning:

D513BDE8E41F4658801960BA49344FA0.description: Students integrate information literacy skills into all areas of learning.

63EB7732D7934D38A91C4FBF4F8B8498.description: Choose an appropriate format to produce, communicate, and present information (e.g., written report, multimedia presentation, graphic presentation).

5812B439751542559782F5487E2E90E5.description: Use information and technology creatively to answer a question, solve a problem, or enrich understanding:

3010EF4F27574886A03913D9559C1848.description: Analyze evidence to support a research question.

31C8F2CFCE404DD592275944C93776B2.description: Draw conclusions and make informed decisions:

EFA5E4A2BC8E49F9B156A6A9C1B2DDB4.description: Understand how to provide limited copyright and authorize use of original works (e.g., Creative Commons).

AB625BCBAE1E49FD9D3104E34F5F3B1A.description: Identify urban legends and hoaxes spread through e-mail and the Internet.

A83A756755BF466BA0C528E380AA6856.description: Identify what constitutes an "uncomfortable" interaction online and how to handle it effectively.

C03ED55D397148C08559004E2B3D1EEA.description: Practice ethical behavior in online interactions.

BDE141B19CB0494F9E5F3834AB704912.description: Identify types of programs that can damage a computer (e.g., virus, worm, Trojan horse, spyware).

593ED9849D10421DB101F52B9D2AB388.description: Articulate and follow the rules for online use at school.

0B7550C193A843ECAF51900493175A3D.description: Recognize academic uses of social networking sites and understand how to use them safely (e.g., know how to adjust privacy settings).

8426056C831444559AD5CB9D57BDDEC0.description: Practice safe handling of personal information online.

CF376D8CF4104DCAB4DC3622B6BB60A5.description: Demonstrate ethical, legal, and safe use of information in print, media, and online resources:

99F2CD4BE9D34C508F2EBC2039A81717.description: Evaluate whether the information is sufficient to answer the question.

6B4569CEEDBF48AEB142A2EF882894F1.description: Consider the need for additional information:

C8DD691EE97447BC821F45D60DCBD66E.description: Explain the authority, timeliness, and/or accuracy of specific information resources.

35D5D3CA00254A78A198843F52B9136B.description: Recognize the importance of the publication date as an indicator of information currency.

242B0341CB404F91856EA58728F27626.description: Identify how visual language creates an impression for the viewer (e.g., angle, lighting, special effects, camera movement).

F360727037854FC08154201AD066EE4E.description: Assess the comprehensiveness, currency, credibility, authority, and accuracy of resources:

1A39E92EFDC14E86887097332C06013D.description: Identify unsupported statements in resources used.

ED66AA7903B447B9A7801E5EB84E39AA.description: Analyze evidence to support a research question.

D8C509ECA8384B468B75C8DCE0403011.description: Analyze information from illustrations, photographs, charts, graphs, maps, tables, and captions.

B7E96C6EAB5C4A4CAAB22053684AF072.description: Determine the relevance of the information:

B4AA5D40CEE44FFBB7AA4682ECC201F7.description: Restate facts and details taken from an information source (print, nonprint, or digital) and organize those ideas for notetaking by using techniques such as outlining, webbing, flowcharting, and so on.

776E595C1E5742568A49696BC2BA5DC7.description: Use several facts from visual or audio media to support a hypothesis.

D533F736DC2B4EEEA5A0B0B0E2E5642F.description: Accurately record citation information for each type of resource used.

AFE04FA9E09F446D9AC4F965F8BE00C9.description: Understand and practice the basics of safe use of the Internet.

D09FBA4D906145B2A09B64FD08B2C164.description: Retrieve information in a timely, safe, and responsible manner:

DA08BB7B1BCC4BA78DC9B0B5A4E2D68A.description: Describe how articles and publications in print may appear different digitally.

E4C36048AB364764A5587F726E0FDB84.description: Identify information that supports the question but may not directly answer it.

5C02789D94F54DFAB59CE0F1DEDE9D87.description: Identify the authority of an author or sponsoring organization in print and online materials.

DC08978C42DC4F3A9952AB61ED140ACA.description: Use Boolean search techniques and other limiters or expanders to locate appropriate resources.

863E932C47D0495497DD00C9042628C5.description: Recognize that specialized encyclopedias differ in arrangement, emphasis, and indexing.

C6930BD8A672433FB5802F3BA09FB4EE.description: Demonstrate knowledge of current applications available online (e.g., photo organizer, presentation generator, document creator, video conferencing).

9BFFD84F43CE40169BC01E6A33459B44.description: Compare and contrast the benefits of using open-source media, subscription databases, print media, and visual media to answer a research question.

E6458DE84EEE4003ADF02281CC8E54E6.description: Demonstrate use of outside sources to obtain information (e.g., Web sites of public libraries and colleges, online databases).

83888E8CD3B64DAC986431D1C8790EDA.description: Demonstrate proper and responsible use of technology and other library materials.

D7F4EE1947414CA888D0739B395D797A.description: Use the World Wide Web, including search engines and browsers, to locate information.

E6AB36427B944D1896019B91EA818F5E.description: Use the automated library catalog to locate resources in other libraries and use interlibrary loan, if available.

EEFF1FD5A6D04FC385E2B05212648616.description: Perform a search of the automated library catalog to locate resources for a particular purpose.

4ED3CBD841444E20B9523645F643A6F4.description: Identify and locate multiple sources of information that provide a broad view of research topics and questions (e.g., books, reference materials, online sources, periodicals).

CA0051028B8C4C798B8B5CEA25EF61B2.description: Identify and locate a variety of resources online and in other formats by using effective search strategies:

9CE2EC035FA04361B9542855C6FC7895.description: Demonstrate the ability to create effective searches in print and online by identifying appropriate key words.

0A5E9C3FAB194E6AAA39121E65438608.description: Identify related key words, terms, and synonyms for the research topic and information needed.

2E717F31F51C44869043386BDDE54229.description: Determine and use appropriate "pre-search" strategies (e.g., brainstorming, recall of prior knowledge).

F9AF0C3DEF8C47298C8002D456223E45.description: Recognize that accurate and comprehensive information is the basis of informed decision making.
